title: Utagawa Hiroshige Plum Garden at Kameido Folding Tote
description:
Foldable Tote developed from Utagawa Hiroshige’s Plum Garden at Kameido (Kameido Umeyashiki), from the series “One Hundred Famous Views of Edo (Meisho Edo hyakkei)”, 1857, from The Art Institute of Chicago’s collection.

The Plum Garden at Kameido is one of Utagawa Hiroshige’s most recognizable designs, because it was famously copied by Vincent van Gogh in 1887. It stands out from other works of the time due to its innovative composition—an extreme close-up of the tree—as well as unexpected colors, especially the reddish sky.

  • Dimensions: 16 in. x 26 in.  Folded:  4.5 x 5 in.
  • Materials: 100% Polyester.
  • Hand wash, hang dry.
  • Folded Tote has small clip to link to a key chain.
